StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genomic Sequencing of Pediatric Rhabdoid Cancers

Person.Organization: MASSACHUSETTS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGYBROAD INSTITUTE, INC.DANA-FARBER CANCER INST

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This work was conducted as part of the Slim Initiative for Genomic Medicine, a joint U.S.-Mexico project funded by the Carlos Slim Health Institute. The work was also supported by grants from the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship, the Garrett B. Smith Foundation, PHS awards R01CA113794 and U01-1156106, a Stand Up to Cancer Innovative Research Grant from the American Association of Cancer Research, and by the NIH grant R01CA46274. The authors request that publications resulting from these data cite the original publication: Lee, et al. "A remarkably simple genome underlies highly malignant pediatric rhabdoid cancers".

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Pediatric Cancer Research
ConsentGroup.name: PCR
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: These data may be used for biomedical research by qualified investigators that are performing research that can only be conducted by using pediatric data (i.e., the research objectives cannot be accomplished using data from adults) and that have likely relevance to developing more effective treatments, diagnostic tests, or prognostic markers for childhood cancers.

StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genomic Sequencing of Pediatric Rhabdoid Cancers

Person.Organization: MASSACHUSETTS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGYBROAD INSTITUTE, INC.DANA-FARBER CANCER INST

ConsentGroup.title: Pediatric Cancer Research and Pediatric Methods
ConsentGroup.name: PCRPM
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: These data may be used for biomedical and/or methods research by qualified investigators that are performing research projects that can only by conducted using pediatric data (i.e., the research objectives cannot be accomplished using data from adults) and that have likely relevance to developing more effective treatments, diagnostic tests, or prognostic markers for childhood cancers.

ConsentGroup.title: Cancer Research
ConsentGroup.name: CR
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the dataset is limited to scientific research relevant to the etiology, prevention, treatment, and late complications of treatment of cancer and for the development of applications proposing analytical methods, software, and other research tools related to cancer.
